org.dotplot.core
Class DotplotService

java.lang.Object
  org.dotplot.core.services.AbstractService<C,PluginHotSpot>
      org.dotplot.core.plugins.PlugableService<DotplotContext>
          org.dotplot.core.DotplotService
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, IService<DotplotContext,PluginHotSpot>, ExecutionUnit
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConverterService, EclipseUIService, FilterService, FMatrixService, QImageService, TokenizerService
public abstract class DotplotService
extends PlugableService<DotplotContext>

This class serves as superclass of all Services of the dotplot system.

Subclasses must implement registerDefaultConfiguration(IConfigurationRegistry) to register their configuration information to the ConfigurationRegistry.

There are two default HotSpots assigned to the DotplotService. These implement the Interceptor Design Pattern to mke the architechture expendable. Through them the DotplotService could be extended with new functionality by modifying the their execution sequence. Every Extention made to the Befor-Hotspot is executed before invoking the TaskProcessor, and the Extentions made to the After-Hotspot are invoked after the TaskProcessor. Using this funktionality it is possible to manipulate the working and resultcontext of the DotplotService.

Hotspots

Hotspot: Befor
Extention: IInterceptor
Parameter: none

Info:
The Befor-Interceptor is executed befor invoking the TaskProcessor.


Hotspot: After
Extention: IInterceptor
Parameter: none

Info:
The After-Interceptor is executed after invoking the TaskProcessor.


Author:
Christian Gerhardt
See Also:

registerDefaultConfiguration

Parameters:

createResultContext

protected abstract IContext createResultContext()
Creates the services's result context.

Subclasses should implement this method to create their result context. This method is invoked right after invoking the TaskProcessor.

Returns:
The result context.

getResultContext

public final IContext getResultContext()
Description copied from interface: IService
Returns a NullContext-object until run() was invoked and the resultcontext is created.

This method should never return null.
In case a Service has no feasible resultcontext a NullContext-object should be returned.

Specified by:
getResultContext in interface IService<DotplotContext,PluginHotSpot>
Specified by:
getResultContext in class AbstractService<DotplotContext,PluginHotSpot>
Returns:
- A NullContext-object befor invoking of run(), and a resultcontext afterwards.

init

public void init()
Description copied from interface: IService
Initializes the Service.

This method is invoked after adding new Extentions to the Service. In normal cases the invokation takes place after all Extentions had bin added.
